original_text:
Annihilator
Era il 1989 quando Alice in Hell, primo album degli Annihilator, fece la sua comparsa nel mondo discografico. Da lì in avanti la band trash metal  capitanata da Jeff Waters ha sfornato parecchi dischi e cavalcato i palchi di tutto il mondo, portando in giro hit intramontabili come Phantasmagorica o The Fun Palace. Il diciassettesimo album della band, Ballistic, Sadistic, è uscito nel 2020 e non è un caso che proprio ora la Play’N’Go abbia voluto rendere omaggio a questo gruppo trash metal con una slot mozzafiato!
Diciamo subito che la grafica di Annihilator è curata nei minimi dettagli, come accade quasi sempre con le slot dedicate a band musicali. Ambientata in una grande villa spettrale, i simboli rappresentano i personaggi che hanno caratterizzato le copertine dei loro numerosi album. Sotto la griglia troviamo i tasti informativi e quelli per il settaggio del gioco, che includono la scelta della puntata, la rotazione manuale o quella automatica dei rulli. Le musiche neanche a dirlo sono le hit della band, che possono essere cambiate a piacimento cliccando sul tasto playlist.
Caratteristiche principali di Annihilator
La griglia di gioco ha un taglio tradizionale 5×3, 10 linee di pagamento e un ritorno teorico al giocatore pari al 96,2%. Le puntate vanno da un minimo di 0,10 € a un massimo di 100 € per giro, con una vincita massima che può pagare sino a 5.000 volte la puntata. Bonus, Scatter e Wild a espansione, assicurano giri gratuiti e  ottime possibilità di vincita.
Simboli e funzionalità
In Annihilator abbiamo diversi simboli. Quelli delle carte da gioco dall’10 all’Asso pagano meno rispetto agli altri. Tra i simboli tematici, in ordine di valore, troviamo la copertina di Annihilator (album del 2010) racchiusa in un quadro, la chitarra elettrica a coda di rondine e la donna con la bambola che appare nel disco d’esordio, Alice in Hell.
Il simbolo Scatter è rappresentato dal diavolo presente nel disco Refresh the Demon. Se appare per tre volte, si attiva il Set the World on Fire, che dà diritto a 8 Free Spins.
Il simbolo Wild è rappresentato da Jeff Waters, sostituisce tutti i simboli tranne lo Scatter e il Bonus. Si tratta di un Wild a espansione che può ricoprire l’intero rullo e che rimane attivo sinché non si ha una vincita. Di tanto in tanto il Wild  attiva una linea di fuoco che occupa diverse posizioni sul rullo. Nel caso appaia un nuovo simbolo Wild in una di queste posizioni, esso si espanderà su tutta la linea di gioco permettendo una vincita molto consistente!
Oltre allo Scatter e al Wild, esiste anche un simbolo Bonus rappresentato dalla bambola, icona del disco di esordio degli Annihilator. Se appare per tre volte, si attiva una speciale funzione chiamata Fun Palace per cui si dovrà scegliere uno tra tre set di bambole e vedere quale premio si nasconde sotto di esso.
Annihilator oltre ad avere grafica e musica coinvolgente, offre ricchi premi, per questo ci sentiamo di suggerirla a occhi chiusi, con la certezza che non vi deluderà.

raw_translation.response:
Annihilator:
In 1989, the world was introduced to Alice in Hell, Annihilator's first album. Since then, Jeff Waters' thrash metal band has produced numerous records and toured around the world, bringing unforgettable hits such as "Phantasmagorica" and "The Fun Palace" with them. Now, in 2020, as the band releases its seventeenth album, Ballistic, Sadistic, Play’N’Go has appropriately released a stunning slot game that pays tribute to the band's legacy.
Right from the start, Annihilator's graphics are carefully and meticulously detailed, as is almost always the case when a slot game is dedicated to a musical band. Set in a grand and eerie villa, the symbols depict characters from the band's plentiful album covers. Beneath the reel set, you'll find the game's informative buttons, including the ones that adjust the game's settings, such as wagering options, spinning reels, and autoplay. Not surprisingly, the game's sound is comprised of the band's greatest hits, which you can customize by clicking on the playlist button.
Annihilator's Key Features:
The game's grid consists of a traditional 5x3 setup, ten pay lines, and has a theoretical return to player rate of 96.2%. The wagering range varies from a minimum of €0.10 to €100 per spin, and the maximum payout is a whopping 5,000 times your wager. Expanding wilds, scatter symbols, and bonus rounds provide you with great opportunities for free spins and lucrative wins.
Symbols and Features:
Annihilator consists of several symbols that vary in terms of their value. The card symbols from ten to ace pay a lower amount than other symbols. The highest-value symbols include the cover art from Annihilator - the album from 2010 - enclosed in a frame, a swallow-tailed electric guitar, and a woman holding a doll, who also appeared on the band's debut album, Alice in Hell.
The scatter symbol is represented by a devil from the album Refresh the Demon. If you land three scatters, the Set the World on Fire round is triggered, which gives you eight free spins.
Jeff Waters represents the wild symbol, which substitutes all symbols except the scatter and bonus symbols. He expands to cover the entire reel and remains active until a win occurs. Every so often, the wild symbol creates a line of fire that occupies various positions on the reel. If another wild symbol lands in one of these positions, it also expands to cover the entire line, resulting in a substantial win.
In addition to the scatter and wild symbols, there's also a bonus symbol represented by the doll from Annihilator's debut album. If you land three bonus symbols, the special Fun Palace round is triggered, where you have to choose from three sets of dolls to reveal a secret prize.
Annihilator not only features immersive graphics and music but also offers rich rewards. Therefore, we highly recommend it to experienced gamblers, with the confidence that it will not disappoint.

raw_translation.response:
Annihilator:

In the world of metal, the name Annihilator is synonymous with pure power and aggression. From their first album Alice in Hell to their most recent release Ballistic, Sadistic, this band has rocked the world with their music. Now, thanks to Play'N'Go, you can experience the thrill of Annihilator with their brand new slot game!

With stunning graphics that capture every detail of the band's iconic look, Annihilator immerses you in a world of metal and mayhem. The reels are set against the backdrop of a haunted mansion, with symbols representing the band's most famous album covers. Under the reels, you'll find the controls for setting your bets and spinning the reels, as well as a playlist button that lets you choose which of the band's hits to listen to.

Annihilator's gameplay is classic, with 5 reels and 10 paylines. You can bet from as little as 0.10€ up to a maximum of 100€ per spin, with a maximum payout of 5,000 times your bet. With Wilds that expand to cover the entire reel, as well as Scatters and Bonuses that can trigger free spins and other exciting features, Annihilator is a slot game that offers excellent chances for big wins.

The symbols in Annihilator include the standard playing card symbols from 10 to Ace, as well as several iconic images from the band's albums. The album art for Annihilator's self-titled 2010 release is the highest-paying symbol, followed by a swallow-tailed electric guitar and the woman with the doll from Alice in Hell.

The Scatter symbol is represented by the devil from Refresh the Demon. Three of these on the reels will trigger the Set the World on Fire feature, giving you 8 free spins. The Wild symbol is represented by the band's founder and leader, Jeff Waters. This expanding Wild can cover the entire reel and trigger a fiery explosion of wins when it expands.

Finally, there is the Bonus symbol, represented by the doll from Alice in Hell. Three of these symbols on the reels will trigger the Fun Palace bonus game, where you'll have to select one of three sets of dolls to reveal your prize.

Annihilator is a slot game that perfectly captures the raw energy and power of this legendary band. With immersive graphics, iconic music, and big rewards, this is one game that no experienced gambler should miss.

Annihilator has a 5x3 grid, ten paylines, and a theoretical Return to Player rate of 96.2%. The game offers a wagering range that starts at €0.10 and goes up to €100 per spin. The slot has expanding wilds, scatter symbols, and bonus rounds that provide free spins and lucrative wins.

Maximum Payout

The maximum payout for Annihilator is an impressive 5,000 times your wager.

Graphics and Atmosphere

Annihilator has meticulously detailed graphics set in a grand and eerie villa, fitting for a metal band's legacy. The symbols depict characters from the band's album covers, and the game's buttons for adjusting gameplay settings, such as wagering options, spinning reels, and autoplay, are informative. The game's sound features the band's greatest hits, which are customizable through the playlist button.

Theme and Symbols

Annihilator's symbols vary in value, with the card symbols paying the lowest amounts. The highest-value symbols consist of the cover art from Annihilator - the album from 2010 - enclosed in a frame, a swallow-tailed electric guitar, and a woman holding a doll, who also appeared on the band's debut album, Alice in Hell. The game's scatter symbol is represented by a devil from the album Refresh the Demon, while the wild symbol is represented by Jeff Waters and his expanding wilds. There's also a bonus symbol represented by the doll from Annihilator's debut album.

Soundtrack Customization

The game's sound is comprised of the band's greatest hits, which you can customize by clicking on the playlist button.

Review: Annihilator:
In 1989, the world was introduced to Alice in Hell, Annihilator's first album. Since then, Jeff Waters' thrash metal band has produced numerous records and toured around the world, bringing unforgettable hits such as "Phantasmagorica" and "The Fun Palace" with them. Now, in 2020, as the band releases its seventeenth album, Ballistic, Sadistic, Play’N’Go has appropriately released a stunning slot game that pays tribute to the band's legacy.
Right from the start, Annihilator's graphics are carefully and meticulously detailed, as is almost always the case when a slot game is dedicated to a musical band. Set in a grand and eerie villa, the symbols depict characters from the band's plentiful album covers. Beneath the reel set, you'll find the game's informative buttons, including the ones that adjust the game's settings, such as wagering options, spinning reels, and autoplay. Not surprisingly, the game's sound is comprised of the band's greatest hits, which you can customize by clicking on the playlist button.
Annihilator's Key Features:
The game's grid consists of a traditional 5x3 setup, ten pay lines, and has a theoretical return to player rate of 96.2%. The wagering range varies from a minimum of €0.10 to €100 per spin, and the maximum payout is a whopping 5,000 times your wager. Expanding wilds, scatter symbols, and bonus rounds provide you with great opportunities for free spins and lucrative wins.
Symbols and Features:
Annihilator consists of several symbols that vary in terms of their value. The card symbols from ten to ace pay a lower amount than other symbols. The highest-value symbols include the cover art from Annihilator - the album from 2010 - enclosed in a frame, a swallow-tailed electric guitar, and a woman holding a doll, who also appeared on the band's debut album, Alice in Hell.
The scatter symbol is represented by a devil from the album Refresh the Demon. If you land three scatters, the Set the World on Fire round is triggered, which gives you eight free spins.
Jeff Waters represents the wild symbol, which substitutes all symbols except the scatter and bonus symbols. He expands to cover the entire reel and remains active until a win occurs. Every so often, the wild symbol creates a line of fire that occupies various positions on the reel. If another wild symbol lands in one of these positions, it also expands to cover the entire line, resulting in a substantial win.
In addition to the scatter and wild symbols, there's also a bonus symbol represented by the doll from Annihilator's debut album. If you land three bonus symbols, the special Fun Palace round is triggered, where you have to choose from three sets of dolls to reveal a secret prize.
Annihilator not only features immersive graphics and music but also offers rich rewards. Therefore, we highly recommend it to experienced gamblers, with the confidence that it will not disappoint.
